alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 24 at 4:26AM AKDT until October 26 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TUESDAY TO 1 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, highest amounts from Soldotna north to Nikiski. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From 10 AM Tuesday to 1 AM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the area from south to north late Tuesday morning through early Tuesday afternoon. Warming temperatures will lead to a change to rain for communities along Kachemak Bay during the early to mid afternoon hours and possibly as far north as Ninilchik later in the day. The heaviest snow will fall near Cook Inlet, including the Sterling Highway corridor, between about 3pm and 9pm.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
